title: The Who's Pete Townshend tells fans to feel Taron Egerton's bum
text:
The Who’s Pete Townshend tells fans to feel Taron Egerton’s bum (Picture: Getty / Instagram)

Taron Egerton is living the life at the moment and recently found himself hanging out with The Who.

You know, after performing in Joni Mitchell’s living room where he sang a number of classic hits with Elton John.

Just a normal day’s work, right?

And now it seems the legendary guitarist Pete Townshend is the actor’s latest fan, as he recently urged music lovers to go and ‘feel’ the Rocketman star’s bum.

We mean, if Pete says so (insert shrug emoji here).

Taking to Instagram, the Kingsman actor shared a picture of himself beaming down the camera while he wrapped his arm around The Who’s frontman, Roger Daltrey.

Pete’s wishes are our command (Picture: Getty Images)

Taron hung out with The Who backstage (Picture: @Taron.Egerton / Instagram)

In the caption, he wrote: ‘Chuffed to bits. Me and Roger. The greatest live voice I have ever heard.’ Sorry, Elton.

‘I had amazing night last night watching The Who who were extraordinary,’ the 29-year-old continued.

‘A big highlight was Pete Townshend @yaggerdang telling the Hollywood Bowl to seek me out and feel my bum.’

He added: ‘That sort of stuff isn’t just in my dreams any more – it actually happens and it’s bloody weird and amazing.’

He is pure BFF goals with Elton John (Picture: WireImage)

Taron is currently enjoying time away in Los Angeles where he took part in a series of interviews with his new BFF, Elton.

And the pair are pure friendship goals, as the Honky Cat hitmaker referred to his buddy as ‘family’.

Asked if he’d offered Taron any career advice, the 70s icon explained he really didn’t think the lad needed it ‘because he seems to have it figured out for himself’.

Explaining how he saw Taron as ‘part of my family’, the 72-year-old continued to tell Entertainment Tonight: ‘He’s much more happy within himself and I think that’s the truth.’

And it appears the feelings are mutual, as the Welsh star admitted: ‘It’s been a very surreal process getting to know him.

‘He doesn’t want me to be constantly looking at him like he’s God. He wants me to look at him like he’s my friend, which he is.’
